fields.name: Notes
fields.value:
* The parameters (year, month, day) must be **numbers**.
* The earliest acceptable year is 1940.

fields.name: What kind of time zones do we use?
fields.value: We use Python's Pytz library. The advantage of using it is that the library takes care of everything, including cases where countries change their offset from GMT in the Summer/Winter, and countries whose offset from GMT is not a whole number. The time zones in this library are based on locations, and the format **Continent/Capital** works for **most** of them.

fields.name: Examples
fields.value:
<PREFIX>timezone America/New_York
<PREFIX>timezone America/Chicago
<PREFIX>timezone America/Los_Angeles
<PREFIX>timezone Asia/Jerusalem
<PREFIX>timezone Asia/Shanghai
<PREFIX>timezone Asia/Tokyo
<PREFIX>timezone Europe/London
<PREFIX>timezone Europe/Paris
<PREFIX>timezone Europe/Moscow

fields.name: Notes
fields.value: * The time zones are **case-sensitive**, pay attention to upper/lower case letters.

birthdays.title: Command: birthdays
birthdays.description: See the server's birthdays in the given month.

fields.name: Notes
fields.value:
* You can use both numbers and names for the month parameter.
* The month is case-insensitive.

channel.title: Command: channel
channel.description: Set the server's birthday announcement channel.

fields.name: Notes
fields.value:
* The parameter should have a blue color after the message has been sent.
* The bot does not accept NSFW channels or channels where it doesn't have the permission to send messages.
* This command can only be used in servers, and only by server administrators.
